original: Berger, Carl Magnus, disponent, Halmstad, f. 18/3/15 i Halmstad av dir. S. E. B. o. Anna Kindal. G. m. Dagmar Boon. Barn: Anne Charlotte f. 42, Per Svante 45. — Stud. v. Halil. konstfören., ordf. i Halmistads flygkl. 44-46, led. av särsk. tax:nd sed. 43, led. av Halmstads istadsfullm. s’ed. 45, fuHm. i Skånes o. Södra Hall. hand :komm. Hobby: konsit. RFinlLO 45, gev:- o. pi-stolskyttem. i guld.
translated: Berger, Carl Magnus was a manager in Halmstad, born on March 18, 1915 in Halmstad to director S. E. B. and Anna Kindal. He was married to Dagmar Boon and had two children: Anne Charlotte (born 1942) and Per Svante (born 1945). He studied at Halmstad Higher Commercial School and completed specialized courses at Gothenburg's Handelsinstitut, DHG and KS. He traveled to the Scandinavian countries, Germany (1931), Switzerland (1931, 1938, 1946, and 1947), England (1932, 1933, 1937, and 1947), France (1937), Belgium (1937, 1947), Czechoslovakia (1946), and Italy (1947). He was a manager and board member of the Malcus Holmquist AB company, a board member of Gothenburg Bank AB, a board member of Foundry Machines AB, Nissaström's Bruks & Kraft AB, Halmstad's Homeowners' Association, and Halmstad Art Association. He was also the chairman of Halmstad Flying Club from 1944 to 1946 and a member of the special tax committee since 1943. He served as a member of the Halmstad City Council from 1945 and was a member of the Skåne and Southern Halland Trade Commission. His hobby was art. He was awarded the Order of the Finnish Lion in gold in 1945, and was also a distinguished rifle and pistol shooter.

memberOf.name: Skåne and Southern Halland Trade Commission
